meanings.definition: Overcome and take control of (a place or people) by military force.
meanings.sent1: The brave knights set out to conquer the enemy castle.
meanings.sent2: The army planned their strategy to conquer the enemy territory.
meanings.sent3: The general joked that he would conquer the battlefield with a feather duster.
meanings.sent4: The conquerors' flag waved proudly over the conquered land.
meanings.sent5: The idea of conquering the mountain filled him with determination.

meanings.definition: Successfully overcome a problem or weakness.
meanings.sent1: She worked hard to conquer her fear of public speaking.
meanings.sent2: With practice, he was able to conquer the difficult math problem.
meanings.sent3: The student felt like a hero after conquering the tricky test.
meanings.sent4: She conquered her fear of heights and climbed to the top of the tower.
meanings.sent5: The team celebrated as they conquered the final challenge.

meanings.definition: Gain the love, respect, or admiration of (someone) by force of personality or other means.
meanings.sent1: The charismatic leader was able to conquer the hearts of the people.
meanings.sent2: She hoped to conquer his affection with her kind gestures.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to conquer the audience with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity helped her conquer the admiration of her peers.
meanings.sent5: He aimed to conquer her respect through hard work and dedication.
